Package lab5

Class CSCD437Crypto

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab5.CSCD437Crypto
  • public class CSCD437Crypto
extends Object
    This is the file that will generate the keys, publish the public key encrypt and decrypt the message. Notice the package statement!
    NOTE: You must use try/catch to handle all of the exceptions possible. You may not use catch(Exxception e) or throws Exception on the method headers for the final version.
    My suggestion is to get the class to work by putting throws Exception on the method headers, and then come back later and handle the exceptions.

    NOTE: You will need the following imports java.io.*, java.security.*, java.util.*, and javax.crypto.*

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSCD437Crypto

        public CSCD437Crypto​(String signatureAlgo,
                     String keyPairAlgo,
                     int keySize)
        The EVC that takes the signature algorithm (See Java API javax.security.Signature), the key pair algorithm (See Java API javax.security.KeyPair) and the key size that must match the key pair algorithm.
        This constructor gets a signature instance, gets a key pair generator instance, initializes the key pair generator to the key pair size, generates a key pair and then sets the class level private and public keys.

        NOTE: Signature/KeyPairGenerator/etc all have checked exceptions that must be handled with try/catch by you
        Parameters:
        signatureAlgo - - A string representing the appropriate algorithm
        keyPairAlgo - - Representing the algorithm to pass to a KeyPairGenerator
        keySize - - Representing the key pair size for the KeyPairGenerator

    • Method Detail

      • generateKeys

        public void generateKeys​(String signatureAlgo,
                         String keyPairAlgo,
                         int keySize)
        This method allows a user to generate a new public/private key and new signature. The method takes the signature algorithm (See Java API javax.security.Signature), the key pair algorithm (See Java API javax.security.KeyPair) and the key size that must match the key pair algorithm.
        This constructor gets a signature instance, gets a key pair generator instance, initializes the key pair generator to the key pair size, generates a key pair and then sets the class level private and public keys.

        NOTE: Signature/KeyPairGenerator/etc all have checked exceptions that must be handled with try/catch by you
        Parameters:
        signatureAlgo - - A string representing the appropriate algorithm
        keyPairAlgo - - Representing the algorithm to pass to a KeyPairGenerator
        keySize - - Representing the key pair size for the KeyPairGenerator

      • publishPublicKey

        public void publishPublicKey​(String filename)
        This method publishes the public key into a ObjectOutputStream file. The filename must first be wrapped in a FileOutputStream, which is then wrapped in a ObjectOutputStream.

        NOTE: FileOutputStream/ObjectOutputStream/etc all have checked exceptions that must be handled with try/catch by you. If the file can't be opened gracefully exit DO NOT reprompt
        Parameters:
        filename - - String representing the name of the file to hold the public key

      • getPublicKey

        public static PublicKey getPublicKey​(String filename)
        This method reads the public key from the file where the public key was published. The public key is read into a ObjectInputStream file. The filename must first be wrapped in a FileInputStream, which is then wrapped in a ObjectInputStream.

        NOTE: FileInputStream/ObjectInputStream/etc all have checked exceptions that must be handled with try/catch by you. If the file can't be opened gracefully exit DO NOT reprompt

        ANOTHER NOTE: This value is NOT stored at the class level for the person that gets the public key it is not that persons public key
        Parameters:
        filename - - String representing the name of the file that holds the public key
        Returns:
        publicKey - Representing a PublicKey object

      • encrypt

        public void encrypt​(PublicKey publicKey,
                    String transformation,
                    String message,
                    String encryptedFilename)
        The encrypt method uses the message receiver's public key and the transformation string to encrypt the message to produce and encrypted file. The transformation string represents the algorithm and the padding for that algorithm. To encrypt you will need to get a Cipher instance (See javax.crypto.Cipher). Once you have a cipher object initialize the mode (encrypt/decrypt) and what key you are using (the receiver's public key). Next convert the message string to a byte array, update the cipher object with the byte array, and then complete the encryption. Once you have the encrypted text use a FileOutputStream object to write the encrypted text to the output file.

        NOTE: FileOutputStream/Cipher/etc all have checked exceptions that must be handled with try/catch by you. If the file can't be opened gracefully exit DO NOT reprompt
        Parameters:
        publicKey - - Representing the message receivers Public Key
        transformation - - A String representing the encryption mode/block or stream cipher/padding
        message - - A String representing the plaintext message to be encrypted
        encryptedFilename - - A String representing the filename to hold the contents of the encrypted message

      • encrypt

        public void encrypt​(PublicKey publicKey,
                    String transformation,
                    File messageFile,
                    String encryptedFilename)
        The encrypt method is overloaded to allow for a text file to be passed in. This method uses the receiver's public key and the transformation string to encrypt the message to produce and encrypted file. The transformation string represents the algorithm and the padding for that algorithm. To encrypt you will need to get a Cipher instance (See javax.crypto.Cipher). Once you have a cipher object initialize the mode (encrypt/decrypt) and what key you are using (the other persons public key). Next open the file using a Scanner. Read from the file and create a single string. If the file has more than one line ensure you write the carriage return per line. Next convert the message string to a byte array, update the cipher object with the byte array, and then complete the encryption. Once you have the encrypted text use a FileOutputStream object to write the encrypted text to the output file.

        NOTE: FileOutputStream/Cipher/etc all have checked exceptions that must be handled with try/catch by you. If either file can't be opened gracefully exit DO NOT reprompt
        Parameters:
        publicKey - - Representing the message receivers Public Key
        transformation - - A String representing the encryption mode/block or stream cipher/padding
        messageFile - - A File object representing the plaintext message to be encrypted as a file
        encryptedFilename - - A String representing the filename to hold the contents of the encrypted message

      • decrypt

        public void decrypt​(String filename,
                    String transformation)
        The decrypt method decrypts the message by using your private key. The method is the reverse of the encrypt method, except it uses your private key. Start by wrapping the filename into a File object. Take that File object and wrap it in a FileInputStream object. Next create a byte array that is the size of the File objects length. Using your FileInputStream object read from the file into the byte array. Next create a Cipher object. Initialize that Cipher object for the mode encypt/decrypt. Complete the process by using the Cipher object to decrypt the encrypted message. Print that message out to the screen as a String.

        NOTE: File/FileInputStream/Cipher/etc all have exceptions that must be handled with try/catch by you. If either file can't be opened gracefully exit DO NOT reprompt
        Parameters:
        filename - - A String representing the name of the file that contains the encrypted message
        transformation - - A String representing the encryption mode/block or stream cipher/padding
